roll up.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to make something into the shape of a tube or ball, or to become this shape
roll up.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Painters arrived and rolled up the carpet.
Many animals roll up into a ball for warmth.
roll up.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to turn the ends of your sleeves or trouser legs over several times so that they are shorter
roll up.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to start doing a job even though it is difficult or you do not want to do it
roll up.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: It’s time to roll up our sleeves and get some work done on the basics.
roll up.translation[0].definitions[3].de: to close the window of a car
roll up.translation[0].definitions[4].de: to arrive somewhere, especially late or when you were not expected
roll up.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: Max rolled up just after 9 o'clock.
roll up.translation[0].definitions[5].de: used to call people to come and watch or buy things at a circus or fair
roll up.translation[1].definitions[0].de: a cigarette that you make yourself
roll up.translation[2].definitions[0].de: if a company or financial institution rolls up the regular payments that would normally be made on an investment, it adds them to the value of the investment and pays them out when the investment MATUREs (=reaches the end of its life)
roll up.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: The interest is rolled up over the life of the security and paid out when it is redeemed.
